text.0:
:cross_mark_button: No, @myNSFAS beneficiaries do not need to re-register their profiles and reapply for 2021 funding due to a system error. 

This is INCORRECT. https://t.co/QLxCGmia0A
text.1: We are happy to be part of this collaborative effort to tackle Covid-19 misinformation and to promote fact-based information in future health emergencies @AfricaCheck @AfricaCheck_Fr https://t.co/Pem14TFvC8
text.2: "Our reason for existence at Africa Check is rooted in a public health crisis - misinformation around polio vaccination campaigns in Nigeria. […] We're very aware that we can't fight misinformation alone, collaboration is essential." - @LMAfrican of @AfricaCheck
text.3: Happening now. Launching of the African Infodemic Response Alliance Network. Misinformation and Disinformation can cause serious consequences. We are proud of the partnership: @UNESCO @ifrc @UNICEF @AfricaCDC @AfricaCheck
text.5:
We held a second webinar with @LMAfrican, @PCunliffeJones and @MarieBohner who discussed @AfricaCheck’s work around misinformation with a focus on Kenya, South Africa and Nigeria 
https://t.co/xlW7J22pgo
text.6: .@LMAfrican, @AfricaCheck: Collaboration is crucial if we are  to have a chance at informing decisions whether at the national, community or personal level. This is why we are keen to leverage our strengths as part of this multi-stakeholder alliance. #AIRA https://t.co/rc4ElIYBqJ
text.7: In our newsletter this week: no major #exam rewrite in #SouthAfrica & verifying #Kenyan governors’ claims of progress. https://t.co/7WqdDLi7ai
text.8:
:delivery_truck: This image doesn't show ‘massive 24-hour roadblocks to remove illegal foreign truck drivers from the road’. 

While taken in #SouthAfrica, the roadblock was to ensure public transport operators & other road users adhered to #Covid lockdown regulations. https://t.co/1XzkyZLJLI
text.9: 3.  How many people in South Africa are living with HIV?
text.10: 2. How many new HIV infections were there in Zimbabwe in 2019?
text.11: 1. True or false? Over 25 million people live with HIV in Africa.
text.12:
1 December marked #WorldAidsDay. 

Take our #miniquiz &  test your knowledge about HIV/AIDS in #Africa. 

(Get clues in our #InfoFinder tool: https://t.co/NnojSqPYbv) https://t.co/ELSVG8IegY
text.13:
:memo: Some #SouthAfrican matric exams were leaked in late November 2020. 

But there's no truth to social media claims that final-year high school students will have to rewrite them, or that universities are now rescinding offers to them. https://t.co/jJxVIUK9EP
